thread.title: Reed helps spark another strong defensive effort from Lions in win
thread.title_full: Reed helps spark another strong defensive effort from Lions in win

title: Reed helps spark another strong defensive effort from Lions in win
text:
Reed helps spark another strong defensive effort from Lions in win Saturday, October 17, 2015 
BETHLEHEM — What’s better than having a talented quarterback in the GISA? 
How about having two that can also play lights out on defense? 
A week after Trinity Christian senior quarterback Tanner Johnson starred on both sides of the ball, another one came up with big plays on offense and defense to help the Lions defeat Bethlehem Christian 41-14 while increasing their win streak to five games. 
With the victory, Trinity (6-2, 4-0 in Region 1-AAA) reached the six-win mark for the third time in four seasons, continuing the feat under first-year head coach Dan Matthews. 
“Our defensive players are really buying into their roles,” Matthews said. “Both of our outside linebackers were hurt this week, but we had guys step in.” 
A week after Johnson moved to the outside, he was joined by Chris Clanton after Jacob Downs was scratched from the lineup. The resulting defensive effort, which also had Luke Vermilya moving to inside linebacker, saw Trinity hold Bethlehem to one score through three quarters while taking a 14-0 lead into halftime. 
Trinity’s other senior starting quarterback — Dominick Reed — sparked his team with an interception late in the first half, setting up the Lions on Bethlehem’s 6-yard line before finishing the offensive drive out on a scoring run. 
Joseph Cotton scored three touchdowns and Vermilya and Ben Kritko also added touchdowns in the victory. 
The win now sets up a showdown for first place in 1-AAA next week at home against Loganville Christian (7-0, 4-0), which was off on Friday. 
A victory by the Lions clinches a region title, while Trinity could finish off a perfect region schedule by picking up wins over Loganville and crosstown rival The Heritage School. More
